laazotea.indi.server

Class AbstractINDIServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.server.AbstractINDIServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultINDIServer

    public abstract class AbstractINDIServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A class representing a INDI Server. It is in charge of dealing with several Drivers and Clients which interexchange messages. Check the INDI documentation to better understand its pourpose. It has the appropriate methods to load / unload several kinds of Drivers: Java Drivers (created with the INDI for Java Driver library, Native Drivers (probably created with the original INDI Library and launched as external processes) and Network Devices (which consist on other INDI Servers). New INDI Servers that implement additional functionality may inherit from this class.
    Version:
    1.34, October 13, 2012
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

        Parameters:
        listeningPort - The port to which the Server will listen.

    • Method Detail

      • startListeningToClients

        protected void startListeningToClients()
        Starts the listening Thread. Should not be called unless the server has been explicitly stopped.

        Gets the port to which the Server listens.
        Returns:
        The port to which the Server listens.

      • run

        public void run()
        The thread listens to the server socket and when a client connects, it is added to the list of clients.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isServerRunning

        protected boolean isServerRunning()
        Gets if the server is listening for new Clients to connect.
        Returns:
        true if the server is listening for new Clients. false otherwise.

      • stopServer

        protected void stopServer()
        Stops the server from listening new Clients. All connections with existing clients are also broken.

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • acceptClient

        protected abstract boolean acceptClient(java.net.Socket socket)
        Must return true is the Client that stablished this connection must be allowed in the Server. Otherwise the connection will be closed.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket created with a possible client.
        Returns:
        true if the Client is allowed to connect to the server. false otherwise.

      • notifyClientListenersEnableBLOB

        protected abstract void notifyClientListenersEnableBLOB(INDIClient client,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
        Notifies Devices of a enableBLOB message (if necessary). Usually it is not necessary to send any message to the Devices about this since the control of BLOB property changes is automatically done in the Server.
        Parameters:
        client - The Client sending the message.
        xml - The message.

        Used to notify extending Servers that some device Names are no longer available.
        Parameters:
